page.title: 11FARMING(CONT.)
page.content: S AFTER WHICH THE MUSHROOMS SHOULD BE READY FOR PICKING.THEY HAVE TO BE GRADED,BASKETTED AND WEIGED AND READY FOR COLLECTION --DAIRY AND BEEF FARMING-- OUR AREA IS A RURAL ONE,AND FARMERS ARE CHIEFLY DAIRY OR BEEF FARMERS BUT A SMALL NUMBER OF FARMERS SPECILISE MUSHROOM GROWING FOR THE MARKETS.DAIRY FARMING IS ON VARIOUS SCALES WITHIN THE DISTRICT RANGING FROM SMALL HERDS OF TEN TO SIXTY COWS. SOME FARMERS USE THE POPULAR BREED OF COWS KNOWN AS FRESIANS BUT SOME USE HEREFORD BULLS FOR BREEDING PURPOSES. FARMERS DAYS VARY ACCORDING TO THE SEASONS OF THE YEAR.HE ALWAYS HAS TO MILK THE COWS TWICE A DAY.THIS ENTAILS OBSERVING STRICT HYGIENE RULES WASHING COWS AND STERILISING EQUIPMENT. TASSAGH AND TULLYGOONIGAN CREAMIE
